intro: Meibomia concinna, commonly known as the slender meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and prominent stamens. Meibomia concinna is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
